{"step_by_step_thinking": "Ductus dependent blood flow refers to the conditions where the blood flow to the body or lungs is dependent on the patent ductus arteriosus. Transposition of great arteries with intact septum, interrupted aortic arch, and hypoplastic left heart syndrome are all conditions where the blood flow is dependent on the patent ductus arteriosus. However, in truncus arteriosus, the blood flow is not dependent on the patent ductus arteriosus because there is a single common vessel that provides blood to the body and lungs.", "answer_choice": "C. Truncus arteriosus"}
